page.title: 12The History of Knolton Hall
page.content: From Elizabethan times a family named Barton lived in the Hall and left it in 1820. They changed it from a farm house into a grand hall. The water was supplied from a spring down the valley, but in the dining room there was also a 19 ft well, which was later filled in. When a gentleman wanted a bath they would go to a hut by the lake and take one besides a fire. A passage was added in Queen Anne's time. Another room was decorated in the Victorian style, updating the furnishings.A long driveway made it possible to see persons approaching the house. A secret underground passage was found which came out by the lake.Perhaps it was built for hiding people. The present owners, proud of its history, maintain its character.
